candidates.title: Code refactoring related with message payload
candidates.body:
* bumps mostro-cli to 0.10.4
* bumps mostro-core to last 0.6.14
* Refactoring to use a new payload structure instead of content
* Update users table structure

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

- **New Features**
	- Updated package version to 0.10.4.
	- Streamlined invoice processing by removing unnecessary signing steps.
	- Enhanced message handling with the introduction of a new `Payload` type.

- **Bug Fixes**
	- Adjusted SQL schema for `users` table to enforce fixed-length public key format.

- **Documentation**
	- Updated comments and parameter names for clarity, reflecting the shift from `Content` to `Payload`.

- **Refactor**
	- Removed the `sign_content` function to simplify message processing.

- **Chores**
	- Various updates to imports and type handling across multiple files for consistency.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: sqlite support and key management implementation
candidates.body:
Table creation on ~/.mcli/mcli.db

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Release Notes

- **New Features**
	- Introduced database connectivity for improved user data management.
	- Added new functionalities for managing user and order data within a SQLite database.
	- Enhanced cryptographic capabilities with new utility functions for file path management.
	- Updated command execution logic to utilize new identity and trade keys for improved security and clarity.

- **Bug Fixes**
	- Improved error handling for database operations.

- **Documentation**
	- Updated module structure to include new database functionalities.

- **Chores**
	- Updated various dependencies to enhance performance and security.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: Bump mostro-core to v0.6.11
candidates.body:
<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Release Notes

- **New Features**
	- Updated `mostro-core` dependency to version `0.6.11`, enhancing performance and stability.
  
- **Improvements**
	- Streamlined message construction in various functions for better clarity and maintainability.
	- Enhanced error handling for UUID parsing and dispute status, providing clearer feedback to users.

These updates aim to improve the overall user experience and reliability of the application.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: New senddm subcommand
candidates.body: This command is needed to allow users to talk to each other after users starts to trade

candidates.title: Update to work with latest mostro-core
Added amount to takesell and takebuy of orders
candidates.body:
Hi @grunch ,

quickly added `amount` parameter to CLI commands `TakeSell` and `TakeBuy`.

Really a no look commit!

candidates.title: Allow use initial vars as args
Tag filter with correct lowercase
candidates.body:
Hi @grunch ,

small fix for tag filter with correct lowercase and updated cargo.lock to sdk 0.29.1 to fix tag parse issue.

candidates.title: Update to nostr sdk lastest version
Implement kebab case mostro core version
Add list disputes command
candidates.body: This command is useful to monitorize Initiated disputes

candidates.title: Add data table tag to filter
Fixes list orders default status (pending)
candidates.body: Fixes kind parameter on neworder command

candidates.title: Dirty fix for remove of clap ValueEnum
candidates.body:
Hi @grunch,

give a look if we are ok! Lookin to this idiot bug in these days crossed my eyes! :eyes:

candidates.title: Use new nostr event kind constant
Refactor CLI structure for reusability and maintainability
candidates.body:
This PR separates the CLI code into a dedicated `cli` module, making it more modular and reusable for future clients. The original code was mostly contained in main.rs, which has now been refactored to improve code organization and maintainability.

The changes in Cargo.toml ensure the proper linking of the new library and binary.

By refactoring the CLI structure, we improve code maintainability and make it easier to extend the application to other clients in the future. One such intention is to use the application logic through FFI in a client built with Flutter.

candidates.title: Refactor for mostro core
candidates.body: Refactoring of Mostro Cli with mostro-core crate.
